speaker: BOTTOM
text: Are we all met?

speaker: QUINCE
text: Pat, pat. And here’s a marvels convenient

speaker: QUINCE
text: place for our rehearsal. This green plot shall be

speaker: QUINCE
text: our stage, this hawthorn brake our tiring-house,

speaker: QUINCE
text: and we will do it in action as we will do it before

speaker: QUINCE
text: the Duke.

speaker: BOTTOM
text: Peter Quince?

speaker: QUINCE
text: What sayest thou, bully Bottom?

speaker: BOTTOM
text: There are things in this comedy of Pyramus

speaker: BOTTOM
text: and Thisbe that will never please. First, Pyramus

speaker: BOTTOM
text: must draw a sword to kill himself, which the ladies

speaker: BOTTOM
text: cannot abide. How answer you that?

speaker: SNOUT
text: By ’r lakin, a parlous fear.

speaker: STARVELING
text: I believe we must leave the killing out,

speaker: STARVELING
text: when all is done.

speaker: BOTTOM
text: Not a whit! I have a device to make all well.

speaker: BOTTOM
text: Write me a prologue, and let the prologue seem to

speaker: BOTTOM
text: say we will do no harm with our swords and that

speaker: BOTTOM
text: Pyramus is not killed indeed. And, for the more

speaker: BOTTOM
text: better assurance, tell them that I, Pyramus, am not

speaker: BOTTOM
text: Pyramus, but Bottom the weaver. This will put them

speaker: BOTTOM
text: out of fear.

speaker: QUINCE
text: Well, we will have such a prologue, and it shall

speaker: QUINCE
text: be written in eight and six.

speaker: BOTTOM
text: No, make it two more. Let it be written in

speaker: BOTTOM
text: eight and eight.

speaker: SNOUT
text: Will not the ladies be afeard of the lion?

speaker: STARVELING
text: I fear it, I promise you.

speaker: BOTTOM
text: Masters, you ought to consider with yourself,

speaker: BOTTOM
text: to bring in (God shield us!) a lion among ladies is a

speaker: BOTTOM
text: most dreadful thing. For there is not a more fearful

speaker: BOTTOM
text: wildfowl than your lion living, and we ought to look

speaker: BOTTOM
text: to ’t.

speaker: SNOUT
text: Therefore another prologue must tell he is not

speaker: SNOUT
text: a lion.

speaker: BOTTOM
text: Nay, you must name his name, and half his

speaker: BOTTOM
text: face must be seen through the lion’s neck, and he

speaker: BOTTOM
text: himself must speak through, saying thus, or to the

speaker: BOTTOM
text: same defect: “Ladies,” or “Fair ladies, I would

speaker: BOTTOM
text: wish you,” or “I would request you,” or “I would

speaker: BOTTOM
text: entreat you not to fear, not to tremble! My life for

speaker: BOTTOM
text: yours. If you think I come hither as a lion, it were

speaker: BOTTOM
text: pity of my life. No, I am no such thing. I am a man as

speaker: BOTTOM
text: other men are.” And there indeed let him name his

speaker: BOTTOM
text: name and tell them plainly he is Snug the joiner.

speaker: QUINCE
text: Well, it shall be so. But there is two hard

speaker: QUINCE
text: things: that is, to bring the moonlight into a chamber,

speaker: QUINCE
text: for you know Pyramus and Thisbe meet by

speaker: QUINCE
text: moonlight.

speaker: SNOUT
text: Doth the moon shine that night we play our

speaker: SNOUT
text: play?

speaker: BOTTOM
text: A calendar, a calendar! Look in the almanac.

speaker: BOTTOM
text: Find out moonshine, find out moonshine.

speaker: QUINCE
text: Yes, it doth shine that night.

speaker: BOTTOM
text: Why, then, may you leave a casement of the

speaker: BOTTOM
text: great chamber window, where we play, open, and

speaker: BOTTOM
text: the moon may shine in at the casement.

speaker: QUINCE
text: Ay, or else one must come in with a bush of

speaker: QUINCE
text: thorns and a lantern and say he comes to disfigure

speaker: QUINCE
text: or to present the person of Moonshine. Then there

speaker: QUINCE
text: is another thing: we must have a wall in the great

speaker: QUINCE
text: chamber, for Pyramus and Thisbe, says the story,

speaker: QUINCE
text: did talk through the chink of a wall.

speaker: SNOUT
text: You can never bring in a wall. What say you,

speaker: SNOUT
text: Bottom?

speaker: BOTTOM
text: Some man or other must present Wall. And

speaker: BOTTOM
text: let him have some plaster, or some loam, or some

speaker: BOTTOM
text: roughcast about him to signify wall, or let him

speaker: BOTTOM
text: hold his fingers thus, and through that cranny shall

speaker: BOTTOM
text: Pyramus and Thisbe whisper.

speaker: QUINCE
text: If that may be, then all is well. Come, sit down,

speaker: QUINCE
text: every mother’s son, and rehearse your parts. Pyramus,

speaker: QUINCE
text: you begin. When you have spoken your

speaker: QUINCE
text: speech, enter into that brake, and so everyone

speaker: QUINCE
text: according to his cue.

speaker: ROBIN
text:
What
               
              hempen
               
              homespuns
               
              have
               
              we
               
              swagg’ring
               
              here

speaker: ROBIN
text:
So
               
              near
               
              the
               
              cradle
               
              of
               
              the
               
              Fairy
               
              Queen
              ?

speaker: ROBIN
text:
What
              ,
               
              a
               
              play
               
              toward
              ?
               
              I’ll
               
              be
               
              an
               
              auditor
              —

speaker: ROBIN
text:
An
               
              actor
               
              too
               
              perhaps
              ,
               
              if
               
              I
               
              see
               
              cause
              .

speaker: QUINCE
text: Speak, Pyramus.—Thisbe, stand forth.

speaker: BOTTOM
text:
Thisbe
              ,
               
              the
               
              flowers
               
              of
               
              odious
               
              savors
               
              sweet
              —

speaker: QUINCE
text: Odors, odors!

speaker: BOTTOM
text:
…
              odors
               
              savors
               
              sweet
              .

speaker: BOTTOM
text:
So
               
              hath
               
              thy
               
              breath
              ,
               
              my
               
              dearest
               
              Thisbe
               
              dear
              .
              —

speaker: BOTTOM
text:
But
               
              hark
              ,
               
              a
               
              voice
              !
               
              Stay
               
              thou
               
              but
               
              here
               
              awhile
              ,

speaker: BOTTOM
text:
And
               
              by
               
              and
               
              by
               
              I
               
              will
               
              to
               
              thee
               
              appear
              .

speaker: ROBIN
text:
A
               
              stranger
               
              Pyramus
               
              than
               
              e’er
               
              played
               
              here
              .

speaker: FLUTE
text: Must I speak now?

speaker: QUINCE
text: Ay, marry, must you, for you must understand

speaker: QUINCE
text: he goes but to see a noise that he heard and is to

speaker: QUINCE
text: come again.

speaker: FLUTE
text:
Most
               
              radiant
               
              Pyramus
              ,
               
              most
               
              lily-white
               
              of
               
              hue
              ,

speaker: FLUTE
text:
Of
               
              color
               
              like
               
              the
               
              red
               
              rose
               
              on
               
              triumphant
               
              brier
              ,

speaker: FLUTE
text:
Most
               
              brisky
               
              juvenal
               
              and
               
              eke
               
              most
               
              lovely
               
              Jew
              ,

speaker: FLUTE
text:
As
               
              true
               
              as
               
              truest
               
              horse
              ,
               
              that
               
              yet
               
              would
               
              never
               
              tire
              .

speaker: FLUTE
text:
I’ll
               
              meet
               
              thee
              ,
               
              Pyramus
              ,
               
              at
               
              Ninny’s
               
              tomb
              .

speaker: QUINCE
text: “Ninus’ tomb,” man! Why, you must not

speaker: QUINCE
text: speak that yet. That you answer to Pyramus. You

speaker: QUINCE
text: speak all your part at once, cues and all.—Pyramus,

speaker: QUINCE
text: enter. Your cue is past. It is “never tire.”

speaker: FLUTE
text: O!

speaker: FLUTE
text:
As
                 
                Thisbe
                .
                 
              
              As
               
              true
               
              as
               
              truest
               
              horse
              ,
               
              that
               
              yet
               
              would
               
              never
               
              tire
              .

speaker: BOTTOM
text:
If
               
              I
               
              were
               
              fair
              ,
               
              fair
               
              Thisbe
              ,
               
              I
               
              were
               
              only
               
              thine
              .

speaker: QUINCE
text: O monstrous! O strange! We are haunted. Pray,

speaker: QUINCE
text: masters, fly, masters! Help!

speaker: ROBIN
text:
ROBIN
            
            
              
                I’ll
                 
                follow
                 
                you
                .
                 
                I’ll
                 
                lead
                 
                you
                 
                about
                 
                a
                 
                round
                ,
              
              
                Through
                 
                bog
                ,
                 
                through
                 
                bush
                ,
                 
                through
                 
                brake
                ,
                 
                through
                 
                brier
                .
              
              
                Sometime
                 
                a
                 
                horse
                 
                I’ll
                 
                be
                ,
                 
                sometime
                 
                a
                 
                hound
                ,
              
              
                A
                 
                hog
                ,
                 
                a
                 
                headless
                 
                bear
                ,
                 
                sometime
                 
                a
                 
                fire
                ,
              
            
            
              
                And
                 
                neigh
                 
                and
                 
                bark
                 
                and
                 
                grunt
                 
                and
                 
                roar
                 
                and
                 
                burn
                ,
              
              
                Like
                 
                horse
                ,
                 
                hound
                ,
                 
                hog
                ,
                 
                bear
                ,
                 
                fire
                ,
                 
                at
                 
                every
                 
                turn
                .

speaker: BOTTOM
text: Why do they run away? This is a knavery of

speaker: BOTTOM
text: them to make me afeard.

speaker: SNOUT
text: O Bottom, thou art changed! What do I see on

speaker: SNOUT
text: thee?

speaker: BOTTOM
text: What do you see? You see an ass-head of your

speaker: BOTTOM
text: own, do you?

speaker: QUINCE
text: Bless thee, Bottom, bless thee! Thou art

speaker: QUINCE
text: translated!

speaker: BOTTOM
text: I see their knavery. This is to make an ass of

speaker: BOTTOM
text: me, to fright me, if they could. But I will not stir

speaker: BOTTOM
text: from this place, do what they can. I will walk up

speaker: BOTTOM
text: and down here, and I will sing, that they shall hear

speaker: BOTTOM
text: I am not afraid.

speaker: TITANIA
text:
What
               
              angel
               
              wakes
               
              me
               
              from
               
              my
               
              flow’ry
               
              bed
              ?

speaker: BOTTOM
text: for, indeed, who would set his wit to so foolish a

speaker: BOTTOM
text: bird? Who would give a bird the lie though he cry

speaker: BOTTOM
text: “cuckoo” never so?

speaker: TITANIA
text:
I
               
              pray
               
              thee
              ,
               
              gentle
               
              mortal
              ,
               
              sing
               
              again
              .

speaker: TITANIA
text:
Mine
               
              ear
               
              is
               
              much
               
              enamored
               
              of
               
              thy
               
              note
              ,

speaker: TITANIA
text:
So
               
              is
               
              mine
               
              eye
               
              enthrallèd
               
              to
               
              thy
               
              shape
              ,

speaker: TITANIA
text:
And
               
              thy
               
              fair
               
              virtue’s
               
              force
               
              perforce
               
              doth
               
              move
               
              me

speaker: TITANIA
text:
On
               
              the
               
              first
               
              view
               
              to
               
              say
              ,
               
              to
               
              swear
              ,
               
              I
               
              love
               
              thee
              .

speaker: BOTTOM
text: Methinks, mistress, you should have little

speaker: BOTTOM
text: reason for that. And yet, to say the truth, reason

speaker: BOTTOM
text: and love keep little company together nowadays.

speaker: BOTTOM
text: The more the pity that some honest neighbors will

speaker: BOTTOM
text: not make them friends. Nay, I can gleek upon

speaker: BOTTOM
text: occasion.

speaker: TITANIA
text:
Thou
               
              art
               
              as
               
              wise
               
              as
               
              thou
               
              art
               
              beautiful
              .

speaker: BOTTOM
text: Not so neither; but if I had wit enough to get

speaker: BOTTOM
text: out of this wood, I have enough to serve mine own

speaker: BOTTOM
text: turn.

speaker: TITANIA
text:
Out
               
              of
               
              this
               
              wood
               
              do
               
              not
               
              desire
               
              to
               
              go
              .

speaker: TITANIA
text:
Thou
               
              shalt
               
              remain
               
              here
               
              whether
               
              thou
               
              wilt
               
              or
               
              no
              .

speaker: TITANIA
text:
I
               
              am
               
              a
               
              spirit
               
              of
               
              no
               
              common
               
              rate
              .

speaker: TITANIA
text:
The
               
              summer
               
              still
               
              doth
               
              tend
               
              upon
               
              my
               
              state
              ,

speaker: TITANIA
text:
And
               
              I
               
              do
               
              love
               
              thee
              .
               
              Therefore
               
              go
               
              with

              .

speaker: TITANIA
text:
I’ll
               
              give

              fairies
               
              to

              on

              ,

And
               
              they

              jewels
               
              from

speaker: TITANIA

And
               
              sing
               
              while
               
              thou
               
              on

              .

And

That
               
              thou

Peaseblossom
              ,

              ,

text:
Be
               
              kind

              to

              in

The

              ,

              for

To

To

speaker: PEASEBLOSSOM
text: Hail, mortal!

speaker: COBWEB
text: Hail!

speaker: MOTE
text: Hail!

speaker: MUSTARDSEED
text: Hail!

speaker: BOTTOM
text: I cry your Worships mercy, heartily.—I beseech

speaker: BOTTOM
text: your Worship’s name.

speaker: COBWEB
text: Cobweb.

speaker: BOTTOM
text: I shall desire you of more acquaintance, good

speaker: BOTTOM
text: Master Cobweb. If I cut my finger, I shall make

speaker: BOTTOM
text: bold with you.—Your name, honest gentleman?

speaker: PEASEBLOSSOM
text: Peaseblossom.

speaker: BOTTOM
text: I pray you, commend me to Mistress Squash,

speaker: BOTTOM
text: your mother, and to Master Peascod, your father.

speaker: BOTTOM
text: Good Master Peaseblossom, I shall desire you of

speaker: BOTTOM
text: more acquaintance too.—Your name, I beseech

speaker: BOTTOM
text: you, sir?

speaker: MUSTARDSEED
text: Mustardseed.

speaker: BOTTOM
text: Good Master Mustardseed, I know your patience

speaker: BOTTOM
text: well. That same cowardly, giantlike ox-beef

speaker: BOTTOM
text: hath devoured many a gentleman of your house. I

speaker: BOTTOM
text: promise you, your kindred hath made my eyes

speaker: BOTTOM
text: water ere now. I desire you of more acquaintance,

speaker: BOTTOM
text: good Master Mustardseed.

speaker: TITANIA
text:
Tie
               
              up
               
              my
               
              lover’s
               
              tongue
              .

              him
               
              silently
              .
